page.title: 16Brighton Aquarium
page.content: Brighton Aquarium was established by a private company in 1869. Scientists praised the internal designs and management. In early days King Edward VII, Queen Alexandra, many European Monarchs, foreign Princes and Oriental Royalty 'toured the tanks'. The original building was designed by Mr E. Birch of London, and it took three years to build it. In 1900 Brighton Corporation acquired it and alterations were made. It was modernised in 1927 and reverted to private enterprise in 1956, a lease was granted to Aquarium Entertainers Ltd. its present owners. In 1968 a major scheme was approved, costing Â£200,000. A pool 80' by 30' and 10' deep was constructed. Filtration equipment installed to ensure the 200,000 gallons of sea_water maintains it's condition.
